TopicTitle: [0.20] Kerbal Space System's first design: the Armoured Exploration Vehicle!

Articles.Content:
Behold! The debut of my new company, with a hardened rover for extended duration stay on other worlds.

Tired of tiny rovers that fall apart when they impact the ground at anything exceeding 20 m/s? Bored of designs that are 'efficient' or 'easy' to get into space? Do you require room for 3+ kerbals for your exploration missions?

Then you'll love KSS's brand new AEV--the Armoured Exploration Vehicle:

This beast will get your kerbals anywhere you wish them to be, and if you run into any pesky piloting errors along the way, such as flipping the rover over, or crashing it into a mountain, then your kerbals will remain safe and sound, nestled within the cosy interior.

Top speed on Kerbin is ~23 m/s, and it is extraordinarily stable at that speed; it could not be flipped over despite our brave testing kerbal's best efforts.

It was also tested on Minmus, which yielded excellent results. While it is prone to losing contact with the ground at times, the rover can get up to 20 m/s easily and climb the highest peaks on the small moon.

It comes complete with two seats for kerbals to sit up front, one flags/EVA fuel/kerbal storage container, and plenty of room for kerbals to sit behind the front seats, as there are landing leg 'doors' included.
